sense.name: recall to mind or keep in mind a piece of information
sense.examples: "Where did you park the car?" "I can't remember." I can remember people's faces, but not their names I finally remembered the address. Then I remembered that today is your birthday. Do you remember that he loved you? I remember how we used to play soccer in the rain. Remember the starving children around the world! I remember him as a rather annoying man. I don't remember signing a contract! Remember your appointment with the dentist.

sense.name: exercise or have power of memory
sense.examples: Some remember better than others. (better ability) After the stroke, she lost her ability to remember.

sense.name: commemorate a special person, event, or occasion
sense.examples: We remembered the 50th anniversary of the liberation of Auschwitz. Remember the dead of the First World War. Mother Theresa will be remembered as long as humanity exists.

sense.name: consider, include
sense.examples: My cousin remembered me in her will. Will you remember him in your prayers?

sense.name: recover one's good manners after behaving badly
